(Re-)Learn C++ by Example - Frances Buontempo  - ACCU 2025 Short Talks
---

(Re-)Learn C++ by Example is a lightning talk by Frances Buontempo at ACCU 2025, encouraging educators and students alike to rediscover the joy of learning C++ through engaging, hands-on examples. Whether you're teaching C++, learning C++ fundamentals, or just looking for a C++ programming book with practical content, this session highlights how small games and fun C++ projects can help make abstract concepts stick.

Frances shares her experience preparing a poster presentation for a hybrid conference with both in-person and Gather Town attendees. Along the way, she discusses how beginner C++ projects — even something as simple as a higher/lower card game — can be powerful teaching tools. These games provide an approachable way to explore C++ enums and variants while reinforcing the fundamentals of the language.

Drawing from her technical book Learn C++ by Ex
title: (Re-)Learn C++ by Example - Frances Buontempo  - ACCU 2025 Short Talks
